title: Test of Trust Referendum
outcome: The Council, desperate to restore legitimacy, initiates an experimental citywide trust referendum where citizens choose between self-organization and restoring the BCI. Vanished citizens intervene, making results unpredictable and forcing Council to acknowledge them publicly. The process brings temporary order but leaves deeper questions of legitimacy and power unresolved.

events.description: The Council announces an unprecedented referendum, letting citizens vote between BCI restoration and continued community self-organization. Debates and assembly meetings quickly spread citywide.

Neighborhood forums are broadcast, revealing sharp divides. Loyalists dominate some districts, while pro-vanished voices gain momentum elsewhere. Vanished citizens covertly facilitate honest vote counting.
Voting is completed. Unexpectedly, several vanished citizens openly deliver verified counts in multiple districts, forcing the Council to acknowledge their existence and impact for the first time.
Official tally shows a narrow majority for ongoing community-led organization. Council publicly accepts the outcome but quietly questions the process's legitimacy, citing security breaches.

Council debates regaining control as some districts form alliances with vanished leaders. Tensions among Council factions intensify with Directorate demanding emergency oversight and Innovators pushing for BCI reform.
